Zumba instructor pleads guilty in prostitution case

Alexis Wright, a dance instructor accused of using her Zumba fitness studio in Portland as a front for prostitution, pleaded guilty today to 20 counts, including engaging in prostitution and tax evasion.

A not-guilty plea was entered on behalf of Detective Lysander Wright, who was arrested in Lynn.

BC warns student group: Stop giving out condoms
